main package#

Submodules#

master module#

Master process for RQ workers

Usage: python master.py -f <path_to_file> -o <path_to_output_directory> [-w <number_of_workers>] [-q <queue_name>]

Arguments: -f, –file: path to the json file with top sites -o, –output: path to the output directory, where the results will be saved -w, –workers: number of workers to spawn -q, –queue: Redis queue name

Exit codes: 1: file not found 1: permission error 1: IO error 1: unexpected error 1: no .env file found 1: queue already exists 1: cannot delete queue 1: cannot push to queue 1: cannot spawn worker

Example: python master.py -f ./data/top_sites.json -o ./output -w 1 -q worker-pool-queue

Author: Stefan Vulpe

Date: 2023/12/28

src.main.master.main()[source]#

Main function

Main function of the master process. It parses the command line arguments, reads the input data from a json file, populates the queue with the input data and spawns the workers.

Exit codes: 1: no .env file found

src.main.master.parse_args()[source]#

Parse command line arguments

Parse command line arguments and return the parsed arguments.

Returns: argparse.Namespace: parsed arguments

src.main.master.populate_queue(redis_conn, queue_name, input_data, output_dir, logger)[source]#

Populates the queue with the input data

Populates the queue with the input data. If the queue already exists, it is deleted and recreated.

Args: redis_conn (redis.Redis): redis connection object queue_name (str): name of the queue input_data (dict): input data output_dir (str): path to the output directory logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Exit codes: 1: queue already exists 1: cannot delete queue 1: cannot push to queue 1: unexpected error

src.main.master.read_input_data(file_path, logger)[source]#

Reads the input data from a json file

Reads the input data from a json file and returns it.

Args: file_path (str): path to the json file logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Returns: dict: input data

Exit codes: 1: file not found 1: permission error 1: IO error 1: unexpected error

src.main.master.spawn_workers(nr_of_workers, queue_name, logger)[source]#

Spawns the workers

Spawns the workers and waits for them to finish.

Args: nr_of_workers (int): number of workers to spawn queue_name (str): name of the queue logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Exit codes: 1: cannot spawn worker

worker module#

Worker process for RQ workers

Usage: python worker.py [-q <queue_name>]

Arguments: -q, –queue: Redis queue name

Exit codes: 1: no .env file found 1: cannot connect to Redis 1: unexpected error

Example: python worker.py -q worker-pool-queue

Author: Stefan Vulpe

Date: 2023/12/28

src.main.worker.download_webpage(url, disk_location, logger)[source]#

Downloads a webpage

Downloads a webpage using asyncio and saves it to disk.

Args: url (str): webpage url disk_location (str): path to the output file logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Returns: None

src.main.worker.main()[source]#

Main function

Main function that spawns the worker process.

Returns: None

src.main.worker.parse_args()[source]#

Parse command line arguments

Parse command line arguments and return the parsed arguments.

Returns: argparse.Namespace: parsed arguments

src.main.worker.process_job(job, logger)[source]#

Processes a job

Processes a job by downloading a webpage.

Args: job (tuple): job tuple logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Returns: None

async src.main.worker.save_webpage(url, disk_location, logger)[source]#

Saves a webpage to disk

Saves a webpage to disk using aiohttp and aiofiles.

Args: url (str): webpage url disk_location (str): path to the output file logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Returns: None

src.main.worker.work(redis_conn, queue_name, logger)[source]#

Worker process

Worker process that gets jobs from the queue and processes them.

Args: redis_conn (Redis): Redis connection object queue_name (str): name of the queue logger (logging.Logger): logger object

Returns: None

Module contents#

Package for the main module.

This module contains the main scripts of the project.

Functions:

  • parse_args: parses the command line arguments

  • read_input_data: reads the input data from a json file

  • populate_queue: populates the queue with the input data

  • spawn_workers: spawns the workers

  • save_webpage: saves a webpage to disk

  • download_webpage: downloads a webpage

  • process_job: processes a job

  • work: main function for the worker process

  • main: main function

Author: Stefan Vulpe

Date: 2023/12/28
